title: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'rpcUrls')
body:
**Describe the bug**

Swap execution fails with "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'rpcUrls')" error during LiFi SDK initialization. The issue occurs because the RPC URLs configuration doesn't match the format expected by the SDK.

**To Reproduce**

1. Initialize SwapAction with a WalletProvider
2. Attempt to execute a swap with a prompt
3. Error occurs during configuration creation in SwapAction constructor

**Expected behavior**

Swap should execute normally

**Screenshots**

Logs : 
```
 ["✓ Normalized action: swap"] 

 ["ℹ Executing handler for action: swap"] 
Error in swap handler: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'rpcUrls')
 ◎ LOGS
   Evaluating 
   GET_FACTS 

 ◎ LOGS
   Evaluating 
   UPDATE_GOAL 

 ◎ LOGS
   Creating Memory 
   3131de6c-ba7b-0dad-b05f-eeed7ceae7ca 
   Error: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'rpcUrls') 
```

**Additional context**

my .env file :

```
.....
# EVM
EVM_PRIVATE_KEY=my_private_key
EVM_PROVIDER_URL=my_eth_mainnet_provider
ETHEREUM_PROVIDER_ARBITRUM_=my_arbitrum_mainnet_provider
ETHEREUM_PROVIDER_ARBITRUM_SEPOLIA=my_arbitrum_sepolia_provider

```

my character file :
```

    "name": "user-agent",
    "clients": ["twitter", "telegram"],
    "modelProvider": "anthropic",
    "settings": {
        "secrets": {},
        "voice": {},
        "chains": { "evm": ["arbitrum", "arbitrumSepolia"] }
    },
    "plugins": ["@elizaos/plugin-evm"],
```

title: agent package not updated on npmjs.org
body:
**Describe the bug**

Seems like @elizaos/agent has not been updated for some time https://www.npmjs.com/package/@elizaos/agent

**To Reproduce**

See https://www.npmjs.com/package/@elizaos/agent?activeTab=versions

**Expected behavior**

Release agent package regularly and use it in `eliza-starter` (as it seems like a lot of stuff is just copy&paste)

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

title: Create a nightly build as next version
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I'd like to use `eliza-starter` with the latest providers and features, but that means I have to wait until new version is released (weekly?). It would be great to setup a `nightly` builds from `develop` and push them to npmjs.org as `next` version, so that people can easily experiment with latest features and get ready for new releases

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Setup an automation to release nightly to from `develop` to `next`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

:shrug: 

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

title: feat: Auto-Documentation Synchronization Bot
body:
## **Overview**
Create an AI assistant to maintain documentation consistency and generate documentation from code.

## **Current Situation**

Documentation gaps often go unnoticed, leading to challenges during onboarding, feature development, and integrations. Outdated information can result in inefficiencies, with developers spending unnecessary time answering questions that could otherwise be handled by AI if up-to-date documentation were available

## **Proposed Solution**

First finish this issue: https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/1110
Next document plugins so that we have a quality reference: https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/1200

Then build a documentation bot that:
1. Tracks and reports TODO comments in code (automate this flow https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/1223)
2. Tracks and reports missing plugin docs: (automate this https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/1200)
3. Tracks commits / issues / PRs and flags docs pages that might need updating
4. Suggest documentation updates of those pages

## **Technical Details**

title: chore: Review TODO notes
body:
**Describe the bug**

See what the TODO notes are about, update their status or document as an issue if needed

- [ ] agent/src/index.ts
- [ ] packages/core/src/models.ts
- [ ] packages/core/src/runtime.ts

- [ ] packages/client-discord/src/actions/summarize_conversation.ts
- [ ] packages/client-slack/src/events.ts


**To Reproduce**

To find the files to fix:

`grep -ro "TODO" --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=dist | uniq` 

Some examples `grep -roP "TODO\s*.*" --exclude-dir=node_modules`
```
agent/src/index.ts:TODO: Add Slack client to the list
packages/core/dist/index.js:TODO: check
packages/core/dist/index.js:TODO: ?download=true
packages/client-discord/src/utils.ts:TODO: clean this up
packages/client-discord/src/attachments.ts:TODO: clean this up
packages/client-discord/src/messages.ts:TODO: This is throwing an error but seems to work?
packages/client-discord/src/messages.ts:TODO: Move to attachments manager
packages/client-discord/src/actions/chat_with_attachments.ts:TODO: make this dynamic and generic
packages/client-discord/src/actions/summarize_conversation.ts:TODO: parse start and end into timestamps
packages/client-slack/src/events.ts:TODO: Implement reaction handling
```

**Expected behavior**

github issue or cleaning up the code

**Screenshots**

title: chore:  Keeps README translations synchronized
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

There are now a lot of language translated READMEs in the repo. If we implement a change in one, we have to manually cascade the changes in order.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Script that uses AI (ollama / openai) that cascades changes when the english README.md file changes. Translates / updates all the other README files. Github CI would be a nice touch too

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

**Additional context**

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/72cc29ce-6a5d-4cbc-9d6b-b6f07c09f399)

title: feat: Eliza Code Assistant default characterfile
body:
**Overview**
Create an AI-powered development guide bot that can assist new contributors and help maintainers by leveraging repository history and documentation. This can be a starter file that teaches people about Eliza as soon as they run Eliza.

**Current Situation**
- New contributors often ask similar questions in discord / twitter
- Repository knowledge is spread across many files and commit history
- Code review assignments are manual and don't always match expertise

**Proposed Solution**
Build an agent that:
1. Answers FAQ-style questions using repo knowledge as recommended first step
2. Suggests relevant examples based on current work
3. Guides contributors to relevant documentation/contributors with answers

**Technical Implementation**
- Create an eliza characterfile template
  - https://elizagen.howieduhzit.best/
- Ingest knowledge about github (prevent duplicate issues, find answers, suggest new issue)
  - https://elizaos.github.io/data/daily/contributors.json
    - https://elizaos.github.io/data/daily/summary.json
    - https://elizaos.github.io/data/daily/summary.md
  - https://elizaos.github.io/data/weekly/contributors.json
  - https://elizaos.github.io/data/monthly/contributors.json
- Ingest docs + FAQ from discord (https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/1044)
  - https://elizaos.github.io/eliza/community/Discord/

**Integration Points (IDEAS)**
- Discord code assistant
- Website frontend  (eliza.gg)
